intro: Liparia comantha, commonly known as the clustered lipara, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are white or pale pink. Liparia comantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
